availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Georgiana Taylor. Father of James Taylor, Sarah Taylor, Elizabeth Taylor, Rebecca Taylor, and Caroline Taylor. Member of a committee to draft resolutions for friends of emancipation and colonization in Mercer County in 1849. Attorney in Mercer County in 1850. Appointed Commissioner to divide Mercer County into election districts in 1850. Member of Board of Directors of Harrodsburg Savings Institution. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1850 and ten enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 908-9.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 3.
“Public Meeting in Mercer,” Courier Journal (Louisville, KY), April 19, 1849.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Passed at the November session, 1850, vol. 1 (Frankfort, KY: A.G. Hodges & Co., State Printers, 1851), 9.
“Death of Major James Taylor,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), January 26, 1876, p. 1.
